text.0: to this our sacrifice come Ṛbhu vibhvan vāja and indra with the gift of riches.
text.1: because this day hath dhiṣaṇā the goddess set drink for you the gladdening draughts have reached you.
text.2: knowing your birth and rich in gathered treasure Ṛbhus rejoice together with the Ṛtus.
text.3: the gladdening draughts and wisdom have approached you send ye us riches with good store of heroes.
text.4: for you was made this sacrifice o Ṛbhus which ye like men won for yourselves aforetime.
text.5: to you come all who find in you their pleasure ye all wereeven the two eldervājas.
text.6: now for the mortal worshipper o heroes for him who served you was the gift of riches.
text.7: drink vājas Ṛbhus unto you is offered to gladden you the third and great libation.
text.8: come to us heroes vājas and Ṛbhukṣans glorified for the sake of mighty treasure.
text.9: these draughts approach you as the day is closing as cows whose calves are newlyborn their stable.
text.10: come to this sacrifice of ours ye children of strength invoked with humble adoration.
text.11: drink of this meath wealthgivers joined with indra with whom ye are in full accord ye princes.
text.12: close knit with varuṇa drink the soma indra closeknit hymnlover with the maruts drink it.
text.13: closeknit with drinkers first who drink in season closeknit with heavenly dames who give us treasures.
text.14: rejoice in full accord with the Ādityas in concord with the parvatas o Ṛbhus.
text.15: in full accord with savitar divine one in full accord with floods that pour forth riches.
text.16: Ṛbhus who helped their parents and the aśvins who formed the milchcow and the pair of horses.
text.17: made armour set the heaven and earth asunderfar reaching heroes they have made good offspring.
text.18: ye who have wealth in cattle and in booty in heroes in rich sustenance and treasure.
text.19: such o ye Ṛbhus first to drink rejoicing give unto us and those who laud our present.
text.20: ye were not far we have not left you thirsting blameless in this our sacrifice o Ṛbhus.
text.21: rejoice you with the maruts and with indra with the kings gods that ye may give us riches.
